intro: Facelis lasiocarpa, commonly known as the hairy-fruited facelis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain several seeds. Facelis lasiocarpa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
